dt-option.name: minDate
dt-option.summary: Set the min date that can be selected and displayed.

type.description: When this option is null there is no min date imposed by DateTime.
This option can also be a string. If this is the case it must be able to be taken by the Date constructor as an argument to create a Date instance to represent the minimum selectable date.
This option can also be a directly given a Date, saving DateTime from creating one from a string.

dt-option.default: As default, no minimum date is applied to DateTime instances.
dt-option.description: This option allows a minimum selectable date to be imposed. This means that users won't be able to view or select dates that occur before the date set here.

example.title: Set minDate to the start of 2000 using a string
Set minDate to the start of 2000 using a Date
